description: Vertical chain of evidence steps with dot markers, gradient connectors, and quoted content. Shows a narrative progression from sources through analysis to conclusions. Each step can contain multiple items (titles, quotes, citations) or a single text block. Usable as a standalone renderer or as a sub-renderer within accordion sections.

steps.description: Ordered list of evidence steps to render. Each step maps a data field to a visual chain element.

label.description: Display label for this step (e.g., 'Prior work', 'Current evidence', 'Assessment')

field.description: Data field to read from the source object

variant.description: Visual variant controlling dot style and connector appearance

item_title_field.description: Within each array item, the field containing the title text

item_quote_field.description: Within each array item, the field containing the quoted text

item_cite_field.description: Within each array item, the field containing the citation/source location

is_text.description: If true, treat the field value as a single text block rather than an array of items

accent_color.description: CSS color for connector gradients and current-step dots. Defaults to neutral gray.

border_color.description: CSS color for quote borders and muted connectors. Defaults to light gray.

input_data_schema.description: Object with fields referenced by each step config. Fields can be arrays of items (for multi-item steps) or strings (for text steps).

tactic_evidence.description: Three-step chain for intellectual genealogy tactics: prior work references, current work evidence, assessment
tactic_evidence.example_use: Tactics & Strategies analysis in intellectual genealogy

argument_chain.description: Three-step chain for argument analysis: premises, reasoning, conclusion
argument_chain.example_use: Argument architecture and logical chain analysis

source_critique.description: Two-step chain for source evaluation: original text and critical assessment
